solution_line_template: First find the total cost of the shirt: ${pants_cost} * {shirt_multiplier} = $<<{pants_cost}*{shirt_multiplier}={shirt_cost}>>{shirt_cost}
Then find the total cost of the tie: ${shirt_cost} / {tie_divisor} = $<<{shirt_cost}/{tie_divisor}={tie_cost}>>{tie_cost}

Then find the cost of one uniform set: ${pants_cost} + ${shirt_cost} + ${tie_cost} + ${socks_cost} = $<<{pants_cost}+{shirt_cost}+{tie_cost}+{socks_cost}={one_uniform_set_cost}>>{one_uniform_set_cost}

Then multiply the cost of each set by the number of sets each student has to buy to find the total cost: ${one_uniform_set_cost}/set * {num_uniforms} sets = $<<{one_uniform_set_cost}*{num_uniforms}={total_cost_per_student}>>{total_cost_per_student}
